channel.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
channel.description:
Maid Spy and Snoop shouldn't be part of the Noble, who manipulates voting. In my opinion, Maid Spy is just ineffective, and Snoop is to overpowered to be on so many classes, (Noble, Aristocrat, Apostle).
I would suggest that the Noble's night abilities be changed to this:
Maid Spy: (Unlimited) (Night) Choose two people not including the King, and you will see all whispers sent to and from them tomorrow.
Order: (3) (Night) Prevent a player from accusing anyone for trial nor voting tomorrow.

item.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
I think you misunderstand what they’re suggesting. Their idea, as I read it, is that every night you can Maid Spy someone and permanently add them to the list of people you’re spying on (so eventually, you’re spying on everyone.) It’s definitely not a nerf.

I like the idea. And I think conspiring outside the night should be a risk.

(Also, this should be a given - when you’re converted, you keep all your spies regardless of what role you become. This would balance out the buff to Maid Spy and make it less valuable as a confirmation, since even an Assassin, Mastermind, or Cult Leader could continue to “prove” they’re a Noble. Additionally, it would free up some of Apostle’s abilities to be used in other ways, since they can use existing Maid Spies to prove that part of the Noble mechanics if challenged.)

item.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
Hmm. To discourage VFR, it might be interesting to have some sort of evil roll that can kill a target at night who was voted up that day, perhaps bypassing protection (since people who claim important roles would be protected otherwise.) I’m not sure what they’d be, though - an NK would probably need other methods of killing too, and the court might rule them out by determining who the NK is early so they don’t need to worry about it.

Maybe an NK who can kill normally, but whose kills bypass all defenses and protectors if their target was voted up that day.

Or just an evil role with the king’s Decide Fate ability, but only for guilty (or, if they’re NK, it could be for anyone, since an NK isn’t really incentivized to save anyone else.) This could allow for an additional cool possibility in that the game could deliberately make it unclear whether Decide Fate was used by the king or that evil role, so an evil king could Decide and then say it was the other person (the court could demand they use their own decision, but that would waste time) - or the evil role could frame the king by Deciding an obviously innocent person guilty, which would lead the court to demand that the king waste their own Decide to show it wasn’t them. Lots of interesting possibilities and would definitely scare off VFRs a bit (imagine hitting the Hunter!)

item.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Aquillion:

People with unverifiable claims usually only get executed when there’s already a credible accusation against them, and at that point evils probably should get executed (the only reason a successful “difficult” claim saves them is because that claim is, well, difficult, and therefore enough to counter an accusation.)

IMO the reason it isn’t a problem, currently, is the lack of a ranked, or veterans mode. (IE a mode without new players). In town of salem, vote for roles was basically a suicide auto lose strategy in ranked practice, and low elo ranked, while in mid-high elo it easilly brought towns winrate over 90%.

It is new players and beginers in the match, that renders strategies like that as high risk. Conversion is fairly irrelevant to it. Especially if you push it early, with emphasis on finding what is most likely to be the CL or assasain, and get him jailed/occupied rather than killing him outright.

Even if you do only execute with solid evidence… you use the claims (and actually press for real logs, you should NEVER let a butler, drunk, observer etc… claim not post his logs by day 4.). Once you’ve got the 60% that more or less can’t be faked. than any investigatives left have a super narrow pool to actually have to search.

item.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Solic:

What nobles in game do you actually see posting whole logs? Most nobles that I have seen merely state: has princess log/has knight log or whatever

very few, because for the most part, people don’t expend the effort to counter the accusation. 99% of accusations are true, if they aren’t true then they are generally claiming to be a class that fits into one of my examples of fakable.

If it weren’t basically unheard of to try, it would be eliminated by an even semi competent BD that would ask for the full logs and check them any time an observer outed himself and made a claim… if you’ve already done the risky thing and outed your class, why not take the 2 seconds to reveal your logs, and the way observer logs work… if it’s day 3, there’s pretty much zero chance you don’t have verifiable visits one way or the other of at least 2 living people (or if you are lying have something claimed that SHOULD be there). IE if anyone you listed visited anyone you listed, or were visited by anyone… you should know about it, whether that be the alc/knight/phys guarding them, the princess or king checking them etc…

But yeah I do agree, people have lately been playing in an extremely uncritical way and evils lately rarely ever do anything active. I’ve taken recently to doing suicide fake accusations as assasain or converted unseen, but it’s seen as such a freakish awful strategy by the community I’ve never once done it without getting yelled at by my fellow unseens (even though the unseen always goes right back to the numbers they had before after my death)

anyway you are right that we are going off topic. But the point I’m making is this only works because playerwise, scorned are the only ones ever likely to do a false accusation. If a ranked, or even a simple “vets only” mode were ever implemented, those sorts of things would be checked in a heartbeat. You are probably right currently because “bob says joe is bad, therefore joe is bad” is about as hard as anyone looks at anything right now, because evil players don’t understand that they are expendable in a conversion based system.

item.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Solic:

A scorned can for instance say that a butler claim has princess logs too. Confirming a person’s ability over multiple nights with for instance a keyword in a specific log is not strong inherent self -confirmation and should not be a problem. Snoop as an ability is completely fine, but it might not fit well on the noble.

as I said, it has nothing to do with a SINGLE use of the ability… a SINGLE use of the ability is absolutely my word over yours. However if I have a claim of Joes logs, AND bob’s logs. and joe can vouch for my logs accuracy while I accuse bob… it’s over for bob, as there’s only 3 explanations for why I’d have multiple points of data on joe

  1. I actually can snoop
  2. Joe is in league with me, in which case we are doing an incredibly stupid play trading 2 of our own for 1 of the BD, unless this kill will completley eliminate BD coming back at us.

Scorned is off the table in explanations. joe would have shouted out the contradiction making trollbox useless.

Same reason why observer to me isn’t so balanced. 2 days worth of observer logs, are completely unfakable. Just picking any 2 people the odds that neither of them visited or were visited by any of the living people and thus the claim is guaranteed to be debunked, is effectively zero. I’d say your odds of succesfully fake claiming psychic and fake claiming observer, are both equally likely to be succesful (which is to say, neither have any rational chance of succeeding unless the majority of the BD, doesn’t know the game whatsoever).

Just on a table of confirmable/investigative here

Princess flirt = fakability 75% (easilly done by mastermind, feasible to fake anything but whisp where even a total guess in the dark has a 1 in 3 odds of being correct).

Observer = fakability = 0% (unless nightwatch) There is absolutely no rational way you can have more than 1 nights worth of logs, that can’t be contradicted by one living player. Unless someone actually buys the claim that you are terrible enough to have used peak on your first 2 days instead of following anyone

Sheriff/pali = fakability = 99%… there’s basically nothing that can trip you up on these. if you are unseen or cult you technically know the right answers, can chose whether to bus or not bus etc…

Inq Magic detection = Fakability = 99% provided BD believes there is a sorc, and there isn’t, 99%. In short, if in doubt claim magic user for anyone. You are only wrong if you claim not magic user when they really are, claiming them as a magic user it must have been dust if they aren’t. Not that this is really worth claiming in any circumstance.

Noble - snoop, confirmability 85%. This is assuming that you have 2 snoops on 2 different still alive people.

What are you meaning by codewords anyway. You don’t need codewords, just 2 days worth of logs

N1. 13 - NS
N2. 5 - NS

Assuming I didn’t already post that publicly… the odds of someone else correctly guessing that, is almost zero.

item.title: Noble Changes - Snoop's OP and Maid Spy's UP
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
This is not the kind of self confirmation I was talking about. There is public and private self-confirmation. Only the person who has been snooped can confirm/not confirm the snoop. There is no disputing a psychic message, but the court still only has 2 people that are in the know of a snoop. The one snooping and the one being snooped. This is not as strong as public self-confirmation, but the noble has that on his day abilities, since he can command someone to vote up someone and that person is unable to rescind. The whole court can see that publicly and he can do it on command. This is way different from snooping’s confirmability. A scorned can for instance say that a butler claim has princess logs too. Confirming a person’s ability over multiple nights with for instance a keyword in a specific log is not strong inherent self -confirmation and should not be a problem. Snoop as an ability is completely fine, but it might not fit well on the noble.

There should be ways in which fake logs can falter, I personally think the observer is a really well designed investigative class, but that’s not the topic of discussion.
